entry.content: "Today I am going to introduce to you 3 works that are probably from the poles of my practice but can be understood by a specific statement that i wrote about 6 months ago when I was asked for a bio on how my practice relates to sculpture. I really struggled with this idea, I would never call myself a sculptor, though my practice somewhat circles the field. So in the process of writing this I came up with one line that stuck with me - \"Sculpture as the marrying of physical and human resources."
